reviewText: Moving documentary.
It has been awhile since I watched this dvd, but from what I remember it was good. I would recommend.
I loved it.
Great bio

This is a good documentary - not as intense as Restrepo, but very well done none-the-less.  One of my closest friends and two acquaintances are in Shepherds; I have nothing but total respect for them, the other members of the documentary, the Oregon National Guard, and our military in general.  "Thank You" truly does not fully express my gratitude to our military, let alone those in Shepherds.
Yes, my grandson was in it.  j
Desent
It was an outstanding movie
I,D SAY THIS IS A GOOD MOVIE FOR ANYONE TO WATCH .
great movie

Shepherds of Helmand is a well-done documentary about Oregon National Guardsmen and their mission in Afghanistan. The stories are important and moving, are are tales that America and Americans should hear and never forget, told in large part by the surviving Guardsmen themselves. Please buy and watch.
Great documentary.
The manufacturing of the DVD itself sometimes cause my DVD player to freeze or skip portions of the video. Bootleg?
excellent
Good documentary. I would recommend RESTREPO or KORENGAL personally.
Good documentary.

I've purchased several docs and movies on the subject of the wars fought in Iraq and Afghanistan.
This is a decent one. They are generally similar, with snippets of real battle arenas and much conversation amongst the soldiers.
God bless those who have given of their time, physical and mental well-being, etc. for America and out of a sense of duty.
It's too bad that Democrats and those in their wake have squandered much of the gains. Tragic. They are very guilty but for some reason they are not held accountable! How a low-life like Hillary Clinton could even be considered as POTUS is insane.
God Bless America. People need to open their eyes and start thinking straight. The Democrat party is a true opiate for the masses.
Very well done documentary.  I do not much like the cover photo used on the DVD case as it has nothing to do with the actual team potrayed or the era but my guess is few care about that.  :-)
Product & service great. Thanks.
Reminded me of Band of Brothers. Well done documentary. Well done Oregon National Guard!
A great DVD about troops in Afghanistan.
It was worth watching.
